title: BSS-002-MOA-001: A Cry For Help
content:
@[Bana Bluntbeak](person:ce6b624f-ad30-4ff7-988b-4d8b040fe958) having not been in @[BSS-001-MIY-000: Maid in Y'Matara](plot:cfbd7381-4c0a-4d7e-96da-bfc0f77608c3) has a different start, read the following: 

[section:dialogue-box] No matter your business this morning, a grave halfling messenger finds you and hands you a sealed parchment.
"Meet me at the Gilded Oasis today as you can," the missive reads. "I beg your help in a delicate matter whose importance cannot be overstated. I shall await you in a purple hooded robe."
The note is signed "@[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1)".
When you look up, the halfling has wandered off.[/section]

@[Bana Bluntbeak](person:ce6b624f-ad30-4ff7-988b-4d8b040fe958) has a pre-existing relationship with @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1), [b][i]Ament Family Friend[/i][/b].

[h2]The Clock Is Ticking[/h2]

The Gilded Oasis, is a plush tavern that caters to the city's merchants and wealthy. It is located within the Merchant Quarter. Once all characters arrive at the tavern, read the following out loud:

[section:dialogue-box] As you enter the Gilded Oasis, you notice a purple-hooded figure tucked into a corner table. @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1) gestures for you to sit. You notice lines of worry etched into her normally cheerful face.

A soft ring of anklets breaks the stillness.

@[Zehra Greenfire](person:189314c0-5bb3-41c2-88e8-bb5ca823a530) steps forward into the centre of a small stage of mosaic glass. Her emerald silks shimmer as though caught between light and dream. Golden charms in her hair catch the glint of torchlight, and her eyes—piercing, ancient, eternal—survey the gathering. Without introduction, she raises her hands and speaks.

“There are those who believe the past is buried beneath us—
But I tell you now: the past walks among us.
Tonight, we sing of one who was never truly lost.
Pharaoh Queen. Flamewalker. Builder of Y'Matara.
Atenara.”
[/section]

Play [url:https://music.youtube.com/watch?v=rK2OHZUTLJs&list=MLPT] Link to YouTube Music[/url]

@[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1) (netural good, human [b]commoner[/b]) has an Intelligence score of [b]18[/b]. After Zehra walks off the stage, she anxiously addresses the characters:

[section: dialogue-box] "Thank you for coming so quickly." she says. "A few weeks ago, I attended a dig in the @[Osirion Wastes](location:78e8189f-bd2a-4a12-bdb8-8b21ab81f9e5) that unearthed a furrowed, light-green stone. I'll give you all the details, but the bottom line is that it isn't a stone at all - it's the egg of an eldritch horror. Moreover, my research indicates it'll hatch at midnight tonight."[br]
"Trouble is, no one will listen to me. The @[Shemsu-Ra](organization:48ed074a-7356-4eb8-88a6-f3bd91c3e4ef) ignored me, and I was caught trying to steal the egg from the @[Grand Eternal Vault](landmark:f5993e95-03f3-4d8d-a525-79400569f23a) so I could contain it. Now I've been expelled from the @[Shemsu-Ra](organization:48ed074a-7356-4eb8-88a6-f3bd91c3e4ef), the @[Eye of Anub-Ka](item:5594fa45-5159-41d5-b743-2a982466c629) display at the vault opens tomorrow, and the egg is about the hatch.[br]
"You've got to steal the @[Eye of Anub-Ka](item:5594fa45-5159-41d5-b743-2a982466c629) and bring it back so I can save the city!".[/section]

[h2]What Samira Ament Knows[/h2]

If the characters talk to Samira further, she gives more information about their mission and what she has learned about the stone:

[b][i]Getting the Egg.[/i][/b] The characters need to reconnoiter the @[Grand Eternal Vault](landmark:f5993e95-03f3-4d8d-a525-79400569f23a) in search of security measures, steal the @[Eye of Anub-Ka](item:5594fa45-5159-41d5-b743-2a982466c629) at an opportune time (see "Stealing the Eye of Anub-Ka" below), and deliver it is Samira. She'll wait for them in an alley within the @[Great Bazaar of Khetem](landmark:c912ecdd-44d7-4e87-a40f-21f258467441).

[b][i]Traits of the Egg.[/i][/b] The @[Eye of Anub-Ka](item:5594fa45-5159-41d5-b743-2a982466c629) can't be damaged or destroyed. Unearthing the egg triggered the rapid development of the creature within, which will soon be ready to hatch.

[b][i]Containing the Egg.[/i][/b] At this point, the only way to keep the egg from hatching is to encase it in a specially prepared crystal container. Samira created a crystal box for this purpose. She still needs to seal cracks in the crystal, so the characters can't take the box with them on the heist.

[b][i]What's in the Egg.[/i][/b] Samira's occult sources indicate an extremely dangerous creature not seen since the Age of of Titans will hatch from the egg unless it can be safely contained.

[h4]Stealing the Eye of Anub-Ka[/h4]

The Eye of Anub-Ka is going on public display tomorrow at the @[Grand Eternal Vault](landmark:f5993e95-03f3-4d8d-a525-79400569f23a), specifically its section that is open to the public known as @[The Bureau of Civic Relics](landmark:399d89f1-c3cf-43f0-832a-2f3890b9f2f8), @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1) explains. A private gala celebrating the new exhibition will occur tonight in the Bureau's second floor Gemstone Wing.

The characters aren't required to attend the gala, but doing so is the only way to glimpse the stone - and the security measures around it - before their heist. @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1) has secured a gala ticket for each character, and she gives them the tickets now.

The characters must wear formal dress to the gala. @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1)  has an appropriate outfit for each character in her heirloom [i]bag of holding[/i].  @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1) lends the bag to the characters to store their adventuring gear, which they'll need while sneaking about the Bureau after hours.

[h4]Samira Ament's Tools[/h4]

Before her unsuccessful attempt to steal the @[Eye of Anub-Ka](item:5594fa45-5159-41d5-b743-2a982466c629), Samira scouted the @[The Bureau of Civic Relics](landmark:399d89f1-c3cf-43f0-832a-2f3890b9f2f8). She pretended to be a patron and recorded the Bureau's layout, filling in what she knows about nonpublic areas, such as the basement.

[b][i]Samira's Map.[/i][/b] Samira gives the characters her sketch of the Bureau before they leave for the gala. Although she's a brilliant academic, Samira is neither an architect nor a burglar. Her map is based on the public map of the Bureau's exhibits, so it is incomplete and lacks informationn about security measures. For instance, Samira knows the Bureau is outfitted with alarms after it closes to the public, but she doesn't know where those alarms are located or how to bypass them.

[h4]Bureau Staff[/h4]

Samira knows that the Bureau has twelve @[Order of Sekhrem-Ra](organization:30949781-e851-4cd3-a15b-620d686e66ac)  guards and that the Bureau's curator - the elf @[Elder Scholar Sarathis Yareen](person:e3a1185d-2b81-4434-961f-426648b62630) - likely has a record of the areas the guards patrol at night. Samira suspects this information is in Yareen's office, located somewhere in the eastern wing on the first floor. Yareen herself will attend the gala.

[h4]The Reward[/h4]

For bringing the @[Eye of Anub-Ka](item:5594fa45-5159-41d5-b743-2a982466c629) back to @[Samira Ament](person:4f7ec176-469e-498e-b19f-19b5d39c1bb1), she offers her [i]bag of holding[/i] plus [b]20 gp[/b] per character. If a character succeeds a [b]DC 13 Charisma (Persuasion) check[/b], Samira increases her offer to [b]30 gp[/b] per character.
